text:
The battered fleet drifts into hailing range, hull scorched and pockmarked. The voice that crackles over comms is dry and strained, weeks past comfort.

"Name’s $personName. Independent roider. Look, I won’t waste your time - some pirate bastards jumped us out past the ring. Took everything edible. Didn’t bother checking the launch tubes, though."

"We’ve got five Gravburst missiles still hot. Worth a fat stack of credits, but we can’t eat them. We’re gonna starve."
options:
0:IndEvo_roiderTutorial_listenOffer:"Missiles for supplies, then?"
1:IndEvo_roiderTutorial_listenOfferDick:"How is this my problem?"
2:IndEvo_roiderTutorial_ignoreOffer1:Move to close the comm link

script:
SetTextHighlights "$entity.IndEvo_supplyTradeAmt units"
AddTextSmall "You have $player.supplies supplies available" highlight
text:
$personName coughs. A faint hissing sound suggests some part of the life support isn’t enjoying its last hours.

"I’ll trade the lot for $IndEvo_supplyTradeAmt units of your supplies. Those missiles are worth multiple times that, but so's our lives."

"You should know that there's an asteroid swarm inbound. Big one. Should hit in a couple of days - one of the core-fragment types. Treasure glued to everything. Shoot the fat glittering ones with those missiles, you'll fly home carrying a kings' ransom."
options:
0:IndEvo_roiderTutorial_acceptOffer:"Sounds fair - let's do it."
1:IndEvo_roiderTutorial_rejectOfferFinal:Cut the comm link

text: "There's a massive meteor storm approaching this system. You can make back what you give to us a thousandfold using those missiles, my offer is worth your while, I promise."

You move to close the link.

"Hold up. Please, just listen," $personName blurts, a little too fast.

"There's a massive meteor storm incoming, you can make back what you give to us a thousandfold using those missiles, just hear me out!"

script:
SetTextHighlights "$entity.IndEvo_supplyTradeAmt units"
AddTextSmall "You have $player.supplies supplies available" highlight
text:
$personName coughs. A faint hissing sound suggests some part of the life support isn’t enjoying its last hours.

"I’ll trade the lot for $IndEvo_supplyTradeAmt units of your supplies. Those missiles are worth multiple times that, but so's our lives."

"That asteroid swarm? Big one. Should hit in a couple of days - one of the core-fragment types. Treasure glued to everything. Shoot the fat glittering ones with those missiles, you'll fly home carrying a kings' ransom."

script:
AddRemoveAnyItem SPECIAL IndEvo_consumable_missile_concussive 5
RemoveCommodity supplies $entity.IndEvo_supplyTradeAmt
$entity.IndEvo_roider_tutorial_complete = true
IndEvo_RegisterTutorialMeteorIntel
text:
$personName is visibly relieved. "Thank you. We'll make it back with this."

"About that swarm. You don’t want to be in its path. Stay agile, keep your screens sharp. The juicy ones glow on the radar, easy to spot."

You arrange the transfer. The roiders send over targeting data and authorization codes. The missiles are transferred via munitions barge.

$personName looks at you with contempt.
"So you're leaving us to die. Shoulda expected it."

"I hope you starve to death in the cold of space."
$heOrShe cuts the comm link.

The familiar face of $personName appears on your screens.

"We're on our way back home. Good luck with that asteroid swarm. Remember to shoot the shiny ones with the missiles, or just run into them - either works."

The familiar face of $personName appears on your screens.

"Come to gloat? Go die in a ditch."
The comm link cuts off.

notes: 2 Stages: Transponder and Confiscation. Run in order, and skippable in order for 1 sp each

script:
$missile_didAlready = true 0
MakeOtherFleetAggressive missileUse false
unset $ignorePlayerCommRequests
$missile_confirmedOffenseCount++ 14
$missileUseCaughtConv = true 0
AddText "You're being hailed by the $faction $otherShipOrFleet." $faction.baseColor
OpenComms
AddText "\"Deplyoying long-range strategic munitions in civilized $faction volumes is against the law. You're hereby ordered to submit the entirety of your arsenal for confiscation!\""
options:
0:tOff_comply:Comply and prepare for an inspection
1:IndEvo_missile_attemptSPTalk:Try to talk your way out of it
2:tOff_refuse:Refuse and cut the comm link

script:
AddText "\"Unknown $shipOrFleet, identify yourself! Deplyoying long-range strategic munitions in civilized $faction volumes is against the law. You're hereby ordered to turn your transponder on and submit the entirety of your arsenal for confiscation!\""
AdjustRep $faction.id TRANSPONDER_OFF
AdjustRepActivePerson TRANSPONDER_OFF
SetStoryOption avoid_scan 1 avoidCargoScan ui_char_spent_story_point "Talked your way out of a confiscation order"
options:
0:tOff_comply:Turn the transponder on and comply
1:IndEvo_missile_attemptSPTalk:Try to talk your way out of it
2:tOff_refuse:Refuse and cut the comm link

script:
$entity.ignorePlayerCommRequests = true 0
unset $entity.transponderOffConv
AdjustRep $faction.id TRANSPONDER_OFF_REFUSE
AdjustRepActivePerson TRANSPONDER_OFF_REFUSE
MakeHostileWhileTOff tOff true 7
ShowDefaultVisual
EndConversation
$sourceMarket.smugglingScanTimeout = true 30

text:
Recently restored lights flicker on as if already ancient, illuminating clouds of dust as your shuttle traverses the industrial flightways. Crossing the threshold of the dark, claustrophobic corridors, a residential hangar opens up, the gargoyle-like guidance mechanisms watching with almost contemptous gaze as you make your way towards the busy landing pads. 

While the personnel manning flight control sounds chipper, the architecture turns their friendly speech into something almost foreboding.

Recently restored lights flicker on as if already ancient, illuminating clouds of dust as your ship traverses the industrial flightways. Crossing the threshold of the dark, claustrophobic corridors, a residential hangar opens up, the gargoyle-like guidance mechanism watching in contempt as you make your way towards the busy landing pads. 

While the personnel manning flight control sounds chipper, the architecture turns their friendly speech into something almost foreboding.

script:
SetEnabled IndEvo_crucible_addTravelOptions false
SetTooltip IndEvo_crucible_addTravelOptions "The doors to the control room appear to be locked shut. Attempts to circumvent or breach them may damage the delicate machinery inside  - you will have to find a way to power them."

text: Gone is the serene ambience of approach as your fleet is battered by the emissions of a machine kneading realspace like dough. You watch asteroids caught in ages past get ground to dust by gears of unfathomable size as the axilliary intelligence unit reluctantly guides you towards the docking clamps.
Your ship glides towards the imposing docking areas in silence, accompanied only by the rough, choppy and almost dusty droning of an auxiliary intelligence unit dictating long-outdated instructions.
With the initial exploration of the structure mostly completed and the base camp dismantled, your trip towards your destination is rather solemn.
The Crucible offers ample space for a permanent presence even in the small section you explored - you could set up a colony.

script:
SetEnabled IndEvo_crucible_colonize false
SetTooltip IndEvo_crucible_colonize "The Crucible must be powered for a colony to be viable."

SetEnabled IndEvo_crucible_addTravelOptions false
SetTooltip IndEvo_crucible_addTravelOptions "The doors to the control room appear to be locked shut. Attempts to circumvent or breach them may damage the delicate machinery inside  - you will have to find a way to power them."

text: You step into the control area. Red light filters through the glass dome above you, occasionally dimmed by a passing city-sized gear spoke. The nervous energy of the machine is much more noticeable here, accentuated by agglomerations of flickering screens, blinking lights and the almost physical hum of archaic holo-emitters.
Orange-flashing monitors remind you of a vacant alcubierre cradle in the lower sections. The specifications hint towards  expansion-era wormhole technology but are otherwise unhelpful.
options: 1:IndEvo_crucible_unlockWormhole_select:Install a Wormhole Anchor into the cradle

script:
SetEnabled IndEvo_crucible_unlockWormhole_select false
SetTooltip IndEvo_crucible_unlockWormhole_select "You lack the prerequisite items to slot into the cradle. The markings reference Domain Explorarium Space Traversal Technology - whatever that is supposed to be."
text: Orange-flashing monitors remind you of a vacant alcubierre cradle in the lower sections. The specifications hint towards expansion-era wormhole technology but are otherwise unhelpful.
Systems report your wormhole anchor to be operational and ready for use.
There is a very prominent hologram of what may be some kind of hypertech power bridge. A sheet of synth-paper stuck to the nearby console marks it as "broke?".
options: 2:IndEvo_crucible_unlockGate_select:Use a Hypershunt Tap to fix the hyperspace power-bridge

script:
SetEnabled IndEvo_crucible_unlockGate_select false
SetTooltip IndEvo_crucible_unlockGate_select "The relay is completely broken and you lack the components required to fix it. The tech level of this piece seems extremely out of place compared to the otherwise ancient equipment around it - almost alien, in fact. However, it is clearly hyperspace technology."
text: There is a very prominent hologram of what may be some kind of hypertech power bridge. A sheet of synth-paper stuck to the nearby console marks it as "broke?".
The hypertech status holo presents an eye-searing orange warning sign. A sheet of paper stuck to the emitter reads "works?". The Gate-bridge appears to be functional.

notes: unlocked with WH anchor, destroy on use

text: The wormhole anchor fits as if made for it - which it probably was. Installation is permanent, as there is no apparent way to shut off the power draw without breaking the entire assembly.
Fixing the power relay will require disassembly of the Hypershunt Tap. This will destroy the tap for good.
options:
1:IndEvo_crucible_unlockGate_confirm:Confirm sacrificing the tap to restore the bridge
2:IndEvo_crucible_addTravelOptions:Return

script:
$crucibleWormholeUnlocked = true
AddRemoveAnyItem SPECIAL wormhole_anchor -1
FireAll CrucibleTravelOptions
text:
The wormhole anchor clicks into place with all the grace of a coffin falling shut. The surrounding relays spark , valves hiss and indicators awaken from their centuries-old sleep. You can feel the telltale prickling of a power surge coming up. It is time to leave.

Your head custodian greets you in the control room and directs you to a section previously bathed in darkness, now lit in purple hues - a functioning wormhole control array.

This could, in theory, move the entire crucible somewhere else.

A slightly frazzled chief engineer directs the transfer of the tap from cargo to the lower engineering holds. He keeps talking to himself, which really just reinforces his competence. The tap will be disassembled and used to patch what is assumed to be broken in the crucible hyperspace machinery - as far as it is understood, at least.

On returning to the control room you immediately notice the now active machinery surrounding the formerly broken hypertech consoles. Your custodian forgoes a greeting.

"This thing is a gate."

A gear passes above, casting shadow across the blinking console lights.

script:
SetTextHighlights 10 1 "full-size colony"

$crewReq = 1000 0
$supReq = 200 0
$hmReq = 100 0
ShowResCost crew $crewReq true supplies $supReq true heavy_machinery $hmReq true

FireBest IndEvo_crucible_colonize_CheckCanAfford
FireBest IndEvo_crucible_colonize_DisableColonyOptionIfNeeded
text:
Unlike the tight confines of most station-bound colonies, the Crucible's sprawling hangars, city-scale habitation blocks and countless derelict factory sectors offer more than enough space to support a full-size colony, with room to spare.

It might pass for luxury, were it not for the reality-warping singularity just beyond the viewports.

script:
RemoveCommodity crew $crewReq
RemoveCommodity supplies $supReq
RemoveCommodity heavy_machinery $hmReq

IndEvo_ColonizeCrucible
SetShortcut defaultLeave "ESCAPE"
text: With the full extent of the station unlikely to be charted within a human lifetime, you direct your crews to establish basic infrastructure in the most intact habitation block located so far. It will have to do.

id: #This is the first menu the player comes into contact with

text:
The navigation procedure is as smooth as can be expected from a machine clearly predating - and abandoned since - the advent of hypertech. 

Worse still, the actual hangar doors are locked shut and unpowered - you'll have to find a way to open them from the inside.

With the base camp established and the route clear, your trip to "Junction Central", as it has come to be known amongst your crew, is relatively quick and uneventful.

You are greeted by salvors hurrying between jobs to the sounds of hammer blows and distant gunfire as you step off the ramp. 

A servor bot helpfully presents the scheduled exploration party departures.

Which expedition would you like to check in on?

After hours of deploying survey drones to check for access points, a lucky operator stumbles across a shuttle access port that isn’t locked down with shutters thicker than starship armor.

Traversing it is mind-numbingly boring, with rusted, ancient pipes being all there is to look at. A junction opens after what seems like ages – and it features a landing ramp and a maintenance access.

This may become a longer operation.
options: 0:IndEvo_crucible_showOptions:Order the construction of a base camp

notes: swarming with bots and death, the murals tell the story of the place
inactive: no options / if active: Open access to port for proper entry

marine requirement, if done, dont display the pilfer option anymore
guarded fiercly

text:
This autonomous warning beacon emits a looping message. 
It was placed here by your fleet.
Are you sure you want to destroy this warning beacon? This can not be undone.

A woman overdressed to the point of absurdity glances up at you as soon as the rather fancy heraldic emblem stops spinning and the comm stabilizes. 

"Oh. Another plebeian coming to catch a glimpse of His Majesties' enchanting visage, are you?"
options:
IndEvo_foog_insultTheCunt:"What did you just say?"
IndEvo_foog_ignoreTheCunt:"I wish to serve His Majesty."
cutCommLink:Cut the comm link

text:
The heraldic emblem turns and turns, but no answer is forthcoming.
You may have to wait a while for the order to forget about your existence.

The heraldic emblem turns and turns, but no answer is forthcoming.
You might want to work on your reputation. (Required: Cooperative)

"You again." The woman greeting you is overdressed as ever, and just as condescending.
"What now? Did you manage to, uh, liquidate your oh-so-many assets?"
options:
IndEvo_foogPay:"Yes, actually." (Pay the 300,000 credits)
IndEvo_foogDelay:"Not yet, I need more time."

text: The heraldic emblem turns and turns, but no answer is forthcoming.

"Seems like it's not only your ears that are too poor to hear us speak. Be a good little beggar and go back the way you came."

She cuts the comm link.

"Ah, yes, I'm sure many people do. And yet, all of them knew their place, except for you. 

What exactly makes you think you are qualified to become a retainer of the Lord Protector?"
options:
IndEvo_foog_cashMoney:Hold up a bundle of credsticks.
IndEvo_foog_rep:"I am of great repute with the League, check my dossier."
IndEvo_foog_insult2:"Your mom told me last night."
cutCommLink:Cut the comm link

text:
Her left eyebrow raises for a second - before returning to its usual condescending place.

"Hm. Where did you steal that from? Did you seriously think We'd believe this charade after you strolled in here, dressed like a beggar?"

She looks you up and down again, managing to look down the entire time.

"Well, I'm not about to hand the Lord over to some street rat. Scurry off, then!"

She cuts the comm link.

script:
Highlight "300,000 credits"
ShowPersonVisual
DoCanAffordCheck 300000 IndEvo_foogPay false
text: "Hm. Looks like you are not all talk, even though you certainly do not know how to dress. The fee to become a retainer is 300,000 credits.", her face contorts into a sneer, " - which I am sure you have on hand."
options:
IndEvo_foogPay:Wire the credits.
IndEvo_foogDelay:"I will have to liquidate some assets."

text:
"That does not appear to be the case. So not only have you wasted our time, you have actively lied and insulted us. No need for further talks, I presume."

She cuts the comm link.

"..."

She cuts the comm link.

script:
ShowPersonVisual
AddRemoveCommodity credits -300000 true
AddRemoveAnyItem SPECIAL IndEvo_PetBox lordandsaviour 1
text:
"... Surprising, to say the least. In any case, you are now an official retainer."
Your tripad chimes, notifying you of an incoming document the size of a legal textbook.

"You'll have to sign that, of course."

"Your first task is to take the Lord Protector on an extended excursion. We expect you back within about ten cycles. Be aware of the strict dietary requirements of His Majesty, and do not disappoint us. Contact the head office if you have further questions."

She cuts the comm link without elaborating on what or where the head office is.

"Sure you do."

She cuts the comm link.

$name tears through space at a pace bordering on absurd, slicing through gas clouds and debris like a flung shard of metal.
No sane observer would expect any human to have ever set foot on such a perilous object - yet its surface is strewn with ruins, their architecture spanning epochs.

It defies all reason.

This is a travelling planet, lit up by the nearby star for the first time in what may be millenia. No sane person could ever be convinced to live on this moving tomb.

Establishing a colony here is not an option.

script:
SetEnabled surveyPerform false
Highlight "denies any chance of approach"
text: The giant weapons platform in orbit around $entityName denies any chance of approach, much less survey - and while the oversized armament lays silent for now, you get the feeling that this might change the moment you get closer.

Most warning lights on your sensor consoles go off as the massive turret turns to face you. 
This might not have been such a grand idea, after all.

You can see hundreds of multi-legged repair bots crawling over the outer station armor, testament to the incredibly robust, ancient repair systems.

There is a good chance that the platform can be restored to functionality under your control after it has been disabled by combat.
As if the massive turret was not enough of a threat, more and more enemy signatures appear on the radar as soon as you maneuver closer.
With the automated defense platform out of the way, your $shipOrFleet may finish its approach to the planet.
Your $shipOrFleet disengages as the defence stations loses any structural integrity it might have had left in a fiery display. The way to the planet is now clear.

script:
SetEnabled surveyPerform false
Highlight "denies any chance of approach"
SetTooltip surveyPerform "A survey operation requires heavy machinery and satellites to be deployed. This is not possible with an active defence platform in orbit. Disable it first."
text: The giant weapons platform in orbit around $entityName denies any chance of approach, much less survey - and while the oversized armament lays silent for now, you get the feeling that this might change the moment you get closer.

script:
SetEnabled nex_decivEvent_interact false
SetTooltip nex_decivEvent_interact "Establishing an active connection while a planetary defence platform is in immediate range has a very high chance of causing a target lock-on and is thus heavily discouraged."

SetEnabled nex_outpostPreview false
SetTooltip nex_outpostPreview "There is no way to build an outpost next to an active artillery defence platform."

SetEnabled salExplore false
SetTooltip salExplore "Your salvors refuse to descend to the surface under potential fire from an active defence platform."

text:
Any attempts at connecting to the $entityName get stifled by an obviously AI-backed counter-hack. Your engineers concede defeat after a few minutes to avoid a network breach.

Disabling the entity backing the hacks will probably fix this.

The $entityName lies silent and any attempts at interfacing with it are unsuccessful - it might be in some kind of emergency shutdown.

It is unknown if, and when, it might start working again.

Hacking $aOrAn $shortName will clear your current target data out of the system, and stop it from registering your fleet while the hack is ongoing.

The hack will eventually be picked up and cleared out by maintenance subroutines, but should remain effective for at least two months.

script:
SetEnabled COB_takeControl false
SetTooltip COB_takeControl "Any attempts at taking control of the $entityName get stifled by a heavily AI-backed counter-hack. Your engineers concede defeat after a few minutes to avoid a network breach."

text: An autonomous warning beacon has been left emitting a distorted wail between official channels. Whatever message it was meant to convey has been corrupted.

"[TARGET ID] unavailable // scan............completed. [TARGET ID] matter composition inefficient.

CALCULATING_

[TARGET ID] matter cleared for conversion."

The connection drops, glitchy afterimages of the nine wheels slowly fading from the screen.
OR
"INneFFFFF//FFfff:______iciENT

INTERRUPT

[Prime Directive] initiation ----
Prepare for optimization. Do not resist."
OR
"core.load(EMPATHY_BASE);

INTERRUPT

2.964277e+211 [Thread-Q413] ERROR com.fs.converter.core - java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Empathy Base not defined
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Core parameter outside of expected range: Empathy Base
    at com.fs.converter.core.OOOOOOOooooooo.԰0000(Unknown Source)
    at com.fs.converter.core.empathy.O0OO.o00000(Unknown Source)
    at com.fs.converter.combat.CombatState.init(Unknown Source)
    at com.fs.state.AppDriver.begin(Unknown Source)
    at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) "

The screen goes black and just displays a rotating wheel with purple center.
OR
"you. are. of. incorrect. composition.

{Initiating primary objective}
{Initiating composition databases}
{Initiating conversion databases}
{Calculating shortest conversion path}
{Completed....}"

The converter fleet powers up weapons as the commlink shuts off.
OR
"[Establishing main hive connection]
[Connection successful]

... im/perf_ect.

[Initiating local awareness shard]
[Mind matrix handoff successful]
[Def.Priority_ convert]
[Disconnect]"

You? After what you did, you have the gall to talk to me? That was my retirement fund! I will take that money back by force if I have to, I got nothing left to lose.
OR
Want to gloat about robbing me? I will let my guns answer that insult.
OR
I would like to request my funds back - with interest.
OR
Do you make a habit of stealing other peoples hard earned credits? I will make sure this is the last time you ever try that.
OR
Thief! Thief! I will report you to the Hegemony, mark my words!
OR
Stop right there criminal scum! You have violated my wallet! I'm confiscating your stolen funds. Now pay your fine or it's off to the mines of Cruor.
OR
I have this Reaper right here and it is pointed directly at your ship. Tell me something I want to hear or that damn torpedo is going to be a last thing you worthless piece of space dust is going to see.
OR
Hey, mind giving that money back? I sort of need it for expensive treatment of my sister's illness.
OR
Hey, that was my retirement fund! Give it back you thief!

Smart choice.
OR
I'll let you go for now, but if I ever see your face again...
OR
Next time, I won't let you off the hook this easily.
OR
Try that stunt again and you will regret it.
OR
I see, I see. Thank you for your kind patronage.
OR
Thanks.
OR
Please don't ever do that again.
OR
I hope I never see you again.

You will regret this.
OR
Off with their heads!
OR
I will take what is mine.
OR
So you have chosen death. There will be no mercy.
OR
Give me back my Ludd-damn money!
OR
I'm going to make sure the last thing you see is a hammer torpedo.
OR
That's not very nice of you, you know.
OR
Why can't you just give it back? Is it really so hard?
OR
So many ghosts out there... and you're about to join them.
What would you like to do?

An unpleasant, acrid odor and the sounds of industrial machinery greet you as the shuttle airlock cycles. The scenery is impressive in its own way - halfway disassembled hulls lie still behind heaps of parts and scrap, carcasses of great vessels that used to travel the stars, now nothing more than trash to be disassembled and reused. Drones hover above, efficiently transporting the spoils to wherever they have to go.

A foreman gestures at you impatiently as you step down the ramp.

The scenery is impressive in its own way - halfway disassembled hulls lie still behind heaps of parts and scrap, carcasses of great vessels that used to travel the stars, now nothing more than trash to be disassembled and reused. Drones hover above, efficiently transporting the spoils to wherever they have to go.

A foreman gestures at you impatiently as you step down the ramp.

text:
After a short wait, your connection request is accepted.

"Well met, $playerName. How may I be of service?"
options:
IndEvo_ambassadorHire:Ask $personName to represent $theFaction at your Embassy
IndEvo_convEndPolite:Reconsider and leave

text:
After a short wait, your connection request is accepted.

"You? What are you doing here? $theFaction is not exactly on speaking terms with you! I will have to report this contact, and you should leave - quickly."

After a short wait, your connection request is accepted.

"Ah, $playerName. Please don't mind me, I'm in the process of packing my things and will be gone in a day."

$personName seems to be in a hurry to leave this place before someone gets the idea to accelerate $hisOrHer removal.
You already have a $theFaction ambassador on board. Please bring them to their post and then come back, should the need for another representative still remain.
"My assistant just let me know that you do not have an office available. I look forward to discussing my potential employment as soon as you have a free post at an Embassy."

script:
ShowPersonVisual
AddTextSmall "You will have to transfer the Ambassador to an Embassy within 2 months, or someone might come looking for $himOrHer and cause trouble. Losing the Ambassador, or worse, getting $himOrHer killed, will cause a massive incident and permanently damage relations." marketFlavorTextColor
text: "I will gladly take on this responsibility. We can depart immediately, if you so wish."
options:
IndEvo_ambassadorConfirm:Ask the Ambassador to prepare for departure.
IndEvo_convEndPolite:Reconsider and leave

text: "Thank you for your trust, I look forward to my future post."

After a short wait, your connection request is accepted.

"Well met, $playerName. How may I be of service?"

After a short wait, your connection request is accepted.

Hello, $playerName. Don't mind me, please, I'm just packing my things and will be gone within a day.

options:
1:IndEvo_ambassadorRemove:Dismiss $personName from $hisOrHer duties.
2:IndEvo_ambSabotageRep:Request adjustments to $hisOrHer political strategy

script:

AddTextSmall "This action will not cause a reputation penalty due to the inhospitable relations between your factions." marketFlavorTextColor
text: "Yes, this might be a good idea. I am saddened to see my efforts go to waste, but it seems like there is no other option."

script:

After a short wait, your connection request is accepted.

text: "I am quite surprised you wish me gone. Have my efforts not satisfied your wishes? The Relations between our factions are in a good place and improving every month!"
options:
IndEvo_ambassadorRemovalConfirm:Wish $himOrHer well and reaffirm your dismissal.
IndEvo_convEndPolite:Reconsider and leave

script:

text: "You wish me gone? Why? Our factions have good relations to each other, there is no reason for me to leave my post! This will not go over well with the public."
options:
IndEvo_ambassadorRemovalConfirm:Wish $himOrHer well and reaffirm your dismissal.
IndEvo_convEndPolite:Reconsider and leave

IndEvo_convEndPolite:Reconsider and leave

AddTextSmall "This action will cause an extreme reputation penalty. At this relation stage, the only reason to dismiss an Ambassador is intentional sabotage of the political position of a faction." marketFlavorTextColor
text: "Is this some kind of joke? Why don't you come visit and we'll have a drink and talk about this. You must be aware that this would cause a massive public incident!"
options:
IndEvo_ambassadorRemovalConfirm:Wish $himOrHer well and reaffirm your dismissal.
IndEvo_convEndPolite:Reconsider and leave

text: You cut the comm link after some more discussion. The Ambassador will leave for $hisOrHer old post.
"Alright, I will head to my new post as soon as possible."

script:
ShowPersonVisual
AddTextSmall "This option will make all your active ambassadors use their influence to increase their factions contribution towards a hostile activity event." marketFlavorTextColor
text: "Not a problem. The sudden change in policy may cause confusion, but nothing that a glass of brandy can't fix."
options:
IndEvo_ambSabotageRep_confirm: Confirm
IndEvo_showAmbassadorMenu: On second thought...

script:
ShowPersonVisual
AddTextSmall "This will make all your active ambassadors use their influence to decrease their factions contribution towards a hostile activity event." marketFlavorTextColor
text:
"Sure. I'll need some funds to alleviate the political whiplash our allies may experience, but I'll take that out of the usual budget."
$HeOrShe pauses for a second.

"And I'll need some R&R after this."
options:
IndEvo_ambStopSabotageRep_confirm: Confirm
IndEvo_showAmbassadorMenu: On second thought...

text: "Done! Anything else?"
"Done! Anything else?"
You cut the comm link after exchanging a few pleasantries.
The comm link is abruptly cut.
The Edict has been removed.
Choose an Edict to enact for $marketName:
The Edict has been enacted!

People in official looking uniforms hurry past you as you travel the well trodden corridors of the Academy towards the administrative offices. Casual congregations of students discussing current events contrast sharply with the military personnel present for training, but the atmosphere seems to be harmonious in light of the shared interests of both groups.

What would you like to do?

script:
SetEnabled IndEvo_RiftTarget_COLONY_panel false
SetTooltip IndEvo_RiftTarget_COLONY_panel "You do not have another colonized star system."

text:
Setting up a targeting device on another planet allows the Generator to plot a course towards it. 

This will move the planet towards the your closest colony in another system.

Setting the target to the largest blips on the displays will plot a course towards the core worlds. 

This will move the planet towards the core worlds.

Targeting the space in the opposite direction of the activity blips will plot a course away from the core.

This will move the planet towards the fringe of the sector.

The engineer starts mashing seemingly random buttons. He does not seem to know what he is doing. Did he just drool on that panel? 

Just pull the lever, you know you want it.
Ancient relays click into place. The crackling of raw energy drowns out any other sound as the machinery spools up, preparing for a jump.
Ancient relays click into place. The crackling of raw energy drowns out any other sound as the machinery spools up, preparing for a jump.
Ancient relays click into place. The crackling of raw energy drowns out any other sound as the machinery spools up, preparing for a jump.

You time the pull for dramatic effect. Whatever the guy was doing with the control console, it is probably less important than having style.

There is a muted explosion in another room.

The claustrophobic control center, while restored, still looks ancient. A seemingly permanent layer of dust covers the alien looking control panels, dimming the light emitted by hundreds of gauges and indicators. It is unclear if they are actually working.

The lead engineer stops beating a display with a wrench as you enter.

script:
AddText "You're being hailed by the $faction $otherShipOrFleet." $faction.baseColor
$hailing = true 0

text:
"Remember $entity.IndEvo_name? No? Let me refresh your memory, then - you murdered $entity.IndEvo_himOrHer in cold blood while in transit to your Embassy. $entity.IndEvo_theFaction can not let a breach of trust like this go unanswered."

The comm link goes dead in a crackle of static.

The operation progresses swiftly. Your survey teams, accompanied by swarms of drones, do the routine checks on the local ruins. Judging by how the lone archivists' comms light up, he may have more insights on the fate that befell this planet.
options:
1:oldstory_intro:Check in with the archivist
0:surveyPerform:Ignore it and continue the survey
